p: There are two main types of MBM: emission trading schemes (ETS), sometimes known as cap-and-trade, and carbon taxes. The two may even apply simultaneously, as well as in the presence of other non-market regulations such as technology standards or subsidies. The market ethics literature (see above) usually discusses only emission trading schemes as MBMs. A carbon tax can be considered more correctly as a financial mechanism which does not create a market, even though it does influence the market as a Pigouvian tax. Both can at least be considered as methods of carbon pricing (Skovgaard et al., 2019). Given that all the literature in the maritime transport sector considers both as MBMs, both will be discussed in this paper.
